page.title: 02HOME LIFE
page.content: My name is Ian McHardy and I am 11 years old. I live in the little village of Jemimaville on the Black Isle. Jemimaville is a one-sided street about 300metres long.The sea is not far from the end of most peoples gardens. There is a barley field in front of the village and trees dotted about here and there. My Mum teaches Art in a High School about 25 miles away from Jemimaville. My Dad has a buisness guiding people in the mountains, skiing, climbing, ice climbing and mountaineering. I also have a younger brother called Alan. At the end of the village there is a small glen called U-dale. We have a swing and two rope bridges up U-dale. It's brilliant fun up there. We also have a gang and gang-hut at the back of the village. It is built from wood and is shaped like a very small house.
